org.datavec.hadoop.records.writer.mapfile

Class AbstractMapFileWriter<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.datavec.hadoop.records.writer.mapfile.AbstractMapFileWriter<T>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MapFileRecordWriter, MapFileSequenceRecordWriter

    public abstract class AbstractMapFileWriter<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    An abstract class For creating Hadoop map files, that underlies MapFileRecordWriter and MapFileSequenceRecordWriter.

        public static final java.lang.String MAP_FILE_INDEX_INTERVAL_KEY
        Configuration key for the map file interval. This is defined in MapFile.Writer.INDEX_INTERVAL but unfortunately that field is private, hence cannot be referenced here.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractMapFileWriter

        public AbstractMapFileWriter(java.io.File outputDir)
        Constructor for all default values. Single output MapFile, no text writable conversion, default index interval (1), default naming pattern.
        Parameters:
        outputDir - Output directory for the map file(s)

      • AbstractMapFileWriter

        public AbstractMapFileWriter(@NonNull
                             java.io.File outputDir,
                             int mapFileSplitSize)
        Constructor for most default values. Specified number of output MapFile s, no text writable conversion, default index interval (1), default naming pattern.
        Parameters:
        outputDir - Output directory for the map file(s)
        mapFileSplitSize - Split size for the map file: if 0, use a single map file for all output. If > 0, multiple map files will be used: each will contain a maximum of mapFileSplitSize. This can be used to avoid having a single multi gigabyte map file, which may be undesirable in some cases (transfer across the network, for example)

      • AbstractMapFileWriter

        public AbstractMapFileWriter(@NonNull
                             java.io.File outputDir,
                             WritableType convertTextTo)
        Parameters:
        outputDir - Output directory for the map file(s)
        convertTextTo - If null: Make no changes to Text writable objects. If non-null, Text writable instances will be converted to this type. This is useful, when would rather store numerical values even if the original record reader produces strings/text.

      • AbstractMapFileWriter

        public AbstractMapFileWriter(@NonNull
                             java.io.File outputDir,
                             int mapFileSplitSize,
                             WritableType convertTextTo)
        Parameters:
        outputDir - Output directory for the map file(s)
        mapFileSplitSize - Split size for the map file: if 0, use a single map file for all output. If > 0, multiple map files will be used: each will contain a maximum of mapFileSplitSize. This can be used to avoid having a single multi gigabyte map file, which may be undesirable in some cases (transfer across the network, for example)
        convertTextTo - If null: Make no changes to Text writable objects. If non-null, Text writable instances will be converted to this type. This is useful, when would rather store numerical values even if the original record reader produces strings/text.

      • AbstractMapFileWriter

        public AbstractMapFileWriter(@NonNull
                             java.io.File outputDir,
                             int mapFileSplitSize,
                             WritableType convertTextTo,
                             int indexInterval,
                             org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration hadoopConfiguration)
        Parameters:
        outputDir - Output directory for the map file(s)
        mapFileSplitSize - Split size for the map file: if 0, use a single map file for all output. If > 0, multiple map files will be used: each will contain a maximum of mapFileSplitSize. This can be used to avoid having a single multi gigabyte map file, which may be undesirable in some cases (transfer across the network, for example)
        convertTextTo - If null: Make no changes to Text writable objects. If non-null, Text writable instances will be converted to this type. This is useful, when would rather store numerical values even if the original record reader produces strings/text.
        indexInterval - Index interval for the Map file. Defaults to 1, which is suitable for most cases
        hadoopConfiguration - Hadoop configuration.

      • AbstractMapFileWriter

        public AbstractMapFileWriter(@NonNull
                             java.io.File outputDir,
                             int mapFileSplitSize,
                             WritableType convertTextTo,
                             int indexInterval,
                             java.lang.String filenamePattern,
                             org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration hadoopConfiguration)
        Parameters:
        outputDir - Output directory for the map file(s)
        mapFileSplitSize - Split size for the map file: if 0, use a single map file for all output. If > 0, multiple map files will be used: each will contain a maximum of mapFileSplitSize. This can be used to avoid having a single multi gigabyte map file, which may be undesirable in some cases (transfer across the network, for example)
        convertTextTo - If null: Make no changes to Text writable objects. If non-null, Text writable instances will be converted to this type. This is useful, when would rather store numerical values even if the original record reader produces strings/text.
        indexInterval - Index interval for the Map file. Defaults to 1, which is suitable for most cases
        filenamePattern - The naming pattern for the map files. Used with String.format(pattern, int)
        hadoopConfiguration - Hadoop configuration.
